title: CPR Asistance System
detail: Improve the effectiveness in emergencies of non-CPR trained people, instantly.
extended_details:
CPR is a process that usually requires special training ahead of time to respond to an emergency effectively. Most of the time, CPR is not done properly, and this reduces the chances of successfully saving people's lives.
To improve the chances of an untrained person being effective, we thought that creating gloves that could give instant feedback on whether the force being applied is sufficient or not. This feedback can be in the way of instructions or visual cues indicating if the CPR is being done correctly, as well as the positioning of the hands.
